013package org.apache.juneau;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.UriRelativity.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.UriResolution.*;
017import static org.apache.juneau.common.utils.ThrowableUtils.*;
018import static org.apache.juneau.common.utils.Utils.*;
019
020import java.io.*;
021import java.net.*;
022
023import org.apache.juneau.common.utils.*;
024
025/**
026 * Class used to create absolute and root-relative URIs based on your current URI 'location' and rules about how to
027 * make such resolutions.
028 *
029 * <p>
030 * Combines a {@link UriContext} instance with rules for resolution ({@link UriResolution} and relativity
031 * ({@link UriRelativity}) to define simple {@link #resolve(Object)} and {@link #append(Appendable, Object)} methods.
032 *
033 * <p>
034 * Three special protocols are used to represent context-root-relative, servlet-relative, and request-path-relative
035 * URIs:
036 *    <js>"context:/"</js>, <js>"servlet:/"</js>, and <js>"request:/"</js>.
037 *
038 * <p>
039 * The following list shows the protocols of URLs that can be resolved with this class:
040 * <ul>
041 *    <li><js>"foo://foo"</js> - Absolute URI.
042 *    <li><js>"/foo"</js> - Root-relative URI.
043 *    <li><js>"/"</js> - Root URI.
044 *    <li><js>"context:/foo"</js> - Context-root-relative URI.
045 *    <li><js>"context:/"</js> - Context-root URI.
046 *    <li><js>"servlet:/foo"</js> - Servlet-path-relative URI.
047 *    <li><js>"servlet:/"</js> - Servlet-path URI.
048 *    <li><js>"request:/foo"</js> - Request-path-relative URI.
049 *    <li><js>"request:/"</js> - Request-path URI.
050 *    <li><js>"foo"</js> - Path-info-relative URI.
051 *    <li><js>""</js> - Path-info URI.
052 * </ul>
053 *
054 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
055 * </ul>
056 */
057public class UriResolver {
058
059   private final UriResolution resolution;
060   private final UriRelativity relativity;
061   private final String authority, contextRoot, servletPath, pathInfo, parentPath;
062
063   /**
064    * Static creator.
065    *
066    * @param resolution Rule on how URIs should be resolved.
067    * @param relativity Rule on what relative URIs are relative to.
068    * @param uriContext Current URI context (i.e. the current URI 'location').
069    * @return A new {@link UriResolver} object.
070    */
071   public static UriResolver of(UriResolution resolution, UriRelativity relativity, UriContext uriContext) {
072      return new UriResolver(resolution, relativity, uriContext);
073   }
074
075   /**
076    * Constructor.
077    *
078    * @param resolution Rule on how URIs should be resolved.
079    * @param relativity Rule on what relative URIs are relative to.
080    * @param uriContext Current URI context (i.e. the current URI 'location').
081    */
082   public UriResolver(UriResolution resolution, UriRelativity relativity, UriContext uriContext) {
083      this.resolution = resolution;
084      this.relativity = relativity;
085      this.authority = uriContext.authority;
086      this.contextRoot = uriContext.contextRoot;
087      this.servletPath = uriContext.servletPath;
088      this.pathInfo = uriContext.pathInfo;
089      this.parentPath = uriContext.parentPath;
090   }
091
092   /**
093    * Converts the specified URI to absolute form based on values in this context.
094    *
095    * @param uri
096    *    The URI to convert to absolute form.
097    *    Can be any of the following:
098    *    <ul>
099    *       <li>{@link java.net.URI}
100    *       <li>{@link java.net.URL}
101    *       <li>{@link CharSequence}
102    *    </ul>
103    *    URI can be any of the following forms:
104    *    <ul>
105    *       <li><js>"foo://foo"</js> - Absolute URI.
106    *       <li><js>"/foo"</js> - Root-relative URI.
107    *       <li><js>"/"</js> - Root URI.
108    *       <li><js>"context:/foo"</js> - Context-root-relative URI.
109    *       <li><js>"context:/"</js> - Context-root URI.
110    *       <li><js>"servlet:/foo"</js> - Servlet-path-relative URI.
111    *       <li><js>"servlet:/"</js> - Servlet-path URI.
112    *       <li><js>"request:/foo"</js> - Request-path-relative URI.
113    *       <li><js>"request:/"</js> - Request-path URI.
114    *       <li><js>"foo"</js> - Path-info-relative URI.
115    *       <li><js>""</js> - Path-info URI.
116    *    </ul>
117    * @return The converted URI.
118    */
119   public String resolve(Object uri) {
120      return resolve(uri, resolution);
121   }
122
123   private String resolve(Object uri, UriResolution res) {
124      String s = s(uri);
125      if (StringUtils.isAbsoluteUri(s))
126         return hasDotSegments(s) && res != NONE ? normalize(s) : s;
127      if (res == ROOT_RELATIVE && StringUtils.startsWith(s, '/'))
128         return hasDotSegments(s) ? normalize(s) : s;
129      if (res == NONE && ! isSpecialUri(s))
130         return s;
131      return append(new StringBuilder(), s).toString();
132   }
133
134   /**
135    * Relativizes a URI.
136    *
137    * <p>
138    * Similar to {@link URI#relativize(URI)}, except supports special protocols (e.g. <js>"servlet:/"</js>) for both
139    * the <c>relativeTo</c> and <c>uri</c> parameters.
140    *
141    * <p>
142    * For example, to relativize a URI to its servlet-relative form:
143    * <p class='bjava'>
144    *    <jc>// relativeUri == "path/foo"</jc>
145    *    String <jv>relativeUri</jv> = <jv>resolver</jv>.relativize(<js>"servlet:/"</js>, <js>"/context/servlet/path/foo"</js>);
146    * </p>
147    *
148    * @param relativeTo The URI to relativize against.
149    * @param uri The URI to relativize.
150    * @return The relativized URI.
151    */
152   public String relativize(Object relativeTo, Object uri) {
153      String r = resolve(relativeTo, ABSOLUTE);
154      String s = resolve(uri, ABSOLUTE);
155      return URI.create(r).relativize(URI.create(s)).toString();
156   }
157
158   /**
159    * Same as {@link #resolve(Object)} except appends result to the specified appendable.
160    *
161    * @param a The appendable to append the URL to.
162    * @param o The URI to convert to absolute form.
163    * @return The same appendable passed in.
164    */
165   public Appendable append(Appendable a, Object o) {
166
167      try {
168         String uri = s(o);
169         uri = nullIfEmpty(uri);
170         boolean needsNormalize = hasDotSegments(uri) && resolution != null;
171
172         // Absolute paths are not changed.
173         if (StringUtils.isAbsoluteUri(uri))
174            return a.append(needsNormalize ? normalize(uri) : uri);
175         if (resolution == NONE && ! isSpecialUri(uri))
176            return a.append(emptyIfNull(uri));
177         if (resolution == ROOT_RELATIVE && StringUtils.startsWith(uri, '/'))
178            return a.append(needsNormalize ? normalize(uri) : uri);
179
180         Appendable a2 = needsNormalize ? new StringBuilder() : a;
181
182         // Root-relative path
183         if (StringUtils.startsWith(uri, '/')) {
184            if (authority != null)
185               a2.append(authority);
186            if (uri.length() != 1)
187               a2.append(uri);
188            else if (authority == null)
189               a2.append('/');
190         }
191
192         // Context-relative path
193         else if (uri != null && uri.startsWith("context:/")) {
194            if (resolution == ABSOLUTE && authority != null)
195               a2.append(authority);
196            if (contextRoot != null)
197               a2.append('/').append(contextRoot);
198            if (uri.length() > 9)
199               a2.append('/').append(uri.substring(9));
200            else if (contextRoot == null && (authority == null || resolution != ABSOLUTE))
201               a2.append('/');
202         }
203
204         // Resource-relative path
205         else if (uri != null && uri.startsWith("servlet:/")) {
206            if (resolution == ABSOLUTE && authority != null)
207               a2.append(authority);
208            if (contextRoot != null)
209               a2.append('/').append(contextRoot);
210            if (servletPath != null)
211               a2.append('/').append(servletPath);
212            if (uri.length() > 9)
213               a2.append('/').append(uri.substring(9));
214            else if (servletPath == null && contextRoot == null && (authority == null || resolution != ABSOLUTE))
215               a2.append('/');
216         }
217
218         // Request-relative path
219         else if (uri != null && uri.startsWith("request:/")) {
220            if (resolution == ABSOLUTE && authority != null)
221               a2.append(authority);
222            if (contextRoot != null)
223               a2.append('/').append(contextRoot);
224            if (servletPath != null)
225               a2.append('/').append(servletPath);
226            if (pathInfo != null)
227               a2.append('/').append(pathInfo);
228            if (uri.length() > 9)
229               a2.append('/').append(uri.substring(9));
230            else if (servletPath == null && contextRoot == null && pathInfo == null && (authority == null || resolution != ABSOLUTE))
231               a2.append('/');
232         }
233
234         // Relative path
235         else {
236            if (resolution == ABSOLUTE && authority != null)
237               a2.append(authority);
238            if (contextRoot != null)
239               a2.append('/').append(contextRoot);
240            if (servletPath != null)
241               a2.append('/').append(servletPath);
242            if (relativity == RESOURCE && uri != null)
243               a2.append('/').append(uri);
244            else if (relativity == PATH_INFO) {
245               if (uri == null) {
246                  if (pathInfo != null)
247                     a2.append('/').append(pathInfo);
248               } else {
249                  if (parentPath != null)
250                     a2.append('/').append(parentPath);
251                  a2.append('/').append(uri);
252               }
253            }
254            else if (uri == null && contextRoot == null && servletPath == null && (authority == null || resolution != ABSOLUTE))
255               a2.append('/');
256         }
257
258         if (needsNormalize)
259            a.append(normalize(a2.toString()));
260
261         return a;
262      } catch (IOException e) {
263         throw asRuntimeException(e);
264      }
265   }
266
267   private static boolean isSpecialUri(String s) {
268      if (s == null || s.isEmpty())
269         return false;
270      char c = s.charAt(0);
271      if (c != 's' && c != 'c' && c != 'r')
272         return false;
273      return s.startsWith("servlet:/") || s.startsWith("context:/") || s.startsWith("request:/");
274   }
275
276   private static String normalize(String s) {
277      s = URI.create(s).normalize().toString();
278      if (s.length() > 1 && s.charAt(s.length()-1) == '/')
279         s = s.substring(0, s.length()-1);
280      return s;
281   }
282
283   private static boolean hasDotSegments(String s) {
284      if (s == null)
285         return false;
286      for (int i = 0; i < s.length()-1; i++) {
287         char c = s.charAt(i);
288         if ((i == 0 && c == '/') || (c == '/' && s.charAt(i+1) == '.'))
289            return true;
290      }
291      return false;
292   }
293}
